content.body: shu: an example of a spec-level vulnerability (as opposed to a vulnerability in any particular implementation): https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44487
content.formatted_body: shu: an example of a spec-level vulnerability (as opposed to a vulnerability in any particular implementation): https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44487

content.body: > Because the attack abuses an underlying weakness in the HTTP/2 protocol, we believe any vendor that has implemented HTTP/2 will be subject to the attack. This included every modern web server.

content.body: ah okay, i can see the case for protocols having such vulnerabilities
